function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Gaps in casbee’s response to prevention of virus propagation indicators pvp1, pvp2, and pvp3","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Missing indicators for water management in the environmental resources category","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Partially addressed indicators in personal comfort and local services categories","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prevention of virus propagation indicators missing","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mental health indicators missing","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air quality indicators missing","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of viruses due to surface contact in the building","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to outdoor spaces and greenery","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unsafe drinking water and wastewater management","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of virus propagation prevention indicators in leed standards","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Missing waste management and mental health subcategories in leed standards","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coverage for energy use and comfort indicators in leed standards","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive pandemic-sustainable indicators","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Focus on current state rather than future states","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Calculation of gap levels for pandemic-sustainable indicators","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on previous research and literature review may result in outdated or incomplete information about pandemic indicators and risk mitigation strategies.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on internationally recognized sustainability systems may not fully address pandemic-specific indicators and risk mitigation strategies.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gap analysis may not capture all pandemic-related sustainability factors, leading to incomplete assessment of building certification systems.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Different building codes and systems of sustainability assessments in different countries may lead to inconsistencies and lack of standardization in pandemic-sustainable criteria for residential buildings.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of a complete system to measure building readiness responding to pandemics may result in incomplete or ineffective preparedness for future pandemics.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imbalance in pandemic response indicators among different gbc&rss may result in limited options for residential buildings to address specific pandemic-related challenges.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of disease transmission in built environments due to lack of sustainable practices and certifications","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of residential buildings as multifunctional spaces during pandemics and post-pandemics","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rise in importance of residential sustainability due to predicted increase in zoonotic diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to urban green spaces leading to overcrowding in existing spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate shading and ventilation in urban green spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination in urban policy and planning to address new behaviors and needs arising from the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases spread through outdoor activities and social interactions in urban parks during the pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher education and knowledge in urban planning may lead to overconfidence in understanding disease transmission dynamics in u urban public parks.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for urban green spaces may lead to overcrowding and insufficient social distancing measures in parks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ugs serving as centers of public gathering can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased importance of green spaces and ugs as places of refuge during the pandemic may lead to overcrowding and congestion in these areas, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ugs for respite and isolation can lead to non-compliance with public health guidelines and riskier behavior in these areas.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced visitation to parks and urban green spaces due to legal restrictions on access","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dichotomy in access to green spaces resulting in localized or long-distance travel","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in use of private cars and increase in pedestrian traffic for reaching green spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced accessibility to ugs due to pandemic restrictions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission risks in densely built urban areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on mental health and well-being due to reduced access to ugs","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on hygiene and sanitation in urban planning and management","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited education and awareness about public health and environmental hygiene","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to green space and nature resulting in poor mental and physical health","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation of green areas with concepts such as ’awareness’, ’city’, ’greenery’, ’lack’, and ’urbanization’.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pca analysis linking ’green areas’, ’trees’, and ’citizens’ with ’nature’, ’man’, and ’to create’.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Thematic analysis identifying concepts related to governance, awareness, and benefits and services in the context of green spaces.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Respondents missing spending time outdoors","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship between visitation frequency and missing ugs","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Word matrix analysis revealing common terms related to nature and urbanization","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High percentage of respondents lack a green view from the window, increasing the risk of limited access to natural environments.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Clear majority of respondents reported missing urban green spaces ugs during the period of closure, indicating a high demand for access to nature.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
